ratings.comment: Very unprepared for classes, only reiterating the points made in class readings. Grading criteria is very unclear and I (only a few weeks from the end of the semester) have only received 2 grades back out of a total of 10 assignments submitted. He frequently goes on unrelated tangents and allows students to delve into unrelated anecdotes in class.

Great lecturer and professor. Cares a lot. Will answer any question you have. Will always help you out when cold calls on you. Grades exams very fairly if he sees you understand the material. Uses real-world examples to explain.

This man is the definition of an ideal teacher. He comes to class every day and engages his students through humorous and meaningful lectures. He Cold-calls reading material but guides students thought it by having them craft logical arguments. Joe welcomes class discussions about the material students care about. Take this class with Joe!

Shumow is the best lecturer Ive had at Madison, and hes not even in academia, hes an actual real estate lawyer. The readings get long and dull due to a lot of legal terminology, but shumow could take the most boring reading and make it incredibly interesting. I laughed at least once a week. Exams are really fair.
One of the best lecturers in the WSoB!! Take good notes during close and know how to apply the information to real-life scenarios.

Great professor! Lectures are never boring because he always keeps students involved. He cold calls using a deck of cards, so be ready. It really makes sure you're prepared for class and never behind. He's a funny guy who knows his stuff and cares about his students. Makes sure to know students' names which is refreshing.

Professor Shumow is passionate and knowledgeable about each and every topic he covers throughout the course! Don't expect to have a normal lecture, because it is entirely based on cold-calling around the room, with required attendance. Shumow's love for Real Estate law is infectious, and you will want him for every class!
